item.title: Understanding Logistic Regression Intuitively
item.description: import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from scipy import optimize import pandas as pd import seaborn as sns from ggplot import * %matplotlib inline Loading the data # Load training data data = pd.read_csv('ex2data2.txt',header=None, names = ('x1','x2','y')) data.info() <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'> Int64Index: 118 entries, 0 to 117 Data columns (total 3 columns): x1 118 non-null float64 x2 118 non-null float64 y 118 non-null int64 dtypes: float64(2), int64(1) memory usage: 3.
